content.value: Seasoned DIY experts like you guys expect a certain level of quality and professionalism when it comes to the people you work with. How did you feel working with the team at DIY Blinds?

Jenna: I know what I want as an Interior Designer so sometimes it can be a little bit hard to work with me. I loved working with the team at DIY Blinds – they know their stuff. When I talk to suppliers and installers, I really want them to be knowledgeable about what they do and we found that with DIY Blinds, I feel like working with them was a collaboration, which I really enjoyed. A collaboration of me knowing the look that I wanted and them knowing the functionality and the practicality and how we can achieve that look.
Somfy Sonesse battery-powered remote control provides whisper quiet operation - a quality choice for motorisation.

contentBlocks.title: “We had the lovely guys from DIY Blinds come to measure-up for us and install them, we needed something that was done and dusted so we could sit back and relax throughout the process!”

content.value: Some opt to go DIY with installation, but you chose to let us help you out. What was the installation experience like for you?

Jenna: The installation process was absolutely straightforward. It was one of the most exciting elements for us because we were moving into the home, we wanted the curtains to come in, it was really that final touch. We had the lovely guys from DIY Blinds come to measure-up for us and install them, so it was practical for us, and with two young kids, we needed something that was done and dusted so we could sit back and relax throughout the process!

Josh: We also have automated blinds in the kids’ room and in the master room and it’s on a wireless remote, so they came and setup all the wireless setup and showed us how to use everything. It was easy to use and maintain.

Josh & Jenna utilised 100% linen curtains from our Laconia range in colour Swan. Behind the S-fold sheer curtains are motorised blockout roller blinds in colour Kew Natural – the perfect combination for any bedroom.

contentBlocks.title: “We’ll definitely be taking DIY Blinds on the next journey with us!”

content.value: There’s so much to like about this cleverly designed property. The use of space and the way the colours of the décor enhance the natural light. What were your favourite features about the finished project and what’s next on your DIY agenda?

Jenna: My favourite features would definitely be the open-plan living-kitchen-dining space. Our sofa is four metres long, so it’s really big and it allows us to have everyone sit within the space and feel like we can all be together. We’ve got our master-suite upstairs, which works really well because it gives us that separation from the kids, and it really does feel like a retreat. There’s a little view of the city at night, which is really beautiful, and it just feels like a really serene space where the curtains close and it’s just an area where it’s a kid-free zone.
Josh: My favourite areas of the house are the open fireplace. I love the little record-player area. The kitchen is amazing and then the pivot-door as well!

Jenna: For us, when we want to design a home, we design it with longevity, timeless design in mind – that makes it the best option for our next home, which will be our second ‘forever home’ and we’ll definitely be taking DIY Blinds on the journey with us!
Keen renovator looking to learn more about interior decorating?
Be sure to check out Jenna's own
Design School
for online courses and hands-on training in the industry!

title: Welcome to Witta Circle where renowned Interior Designer Hong Henwood paired our sheer curtains with this high-end holiday home

contentBlocks.title: An amalgamation of architecture, building and interior design, Witta Circle is a breathtaking property.

content.value: Hong Henwood, Witta Circle is a dream home. The beautiful décor. High ceilings. Soft tones. Natural feel. Each room effortlessly links into the next. It’s modern, elegantly styled and so homely and inviting. And then there’s the greenery cascading down from above. And the stunning vista… Be honest, how excited were you to take on this project?

After previously working with this client on a property in Singapore, when they heard I’d moved to Noosa and they had bought a house there, it was just perfect timing. I was really excited to work on this project! The home turned out fantastic, so it was great to be a part of it.

contentBlocks.title: "We wanted to match the interiors to the elements outside – the water and the garden. We wanted to keep it light. Natural. Airy. Very minimal."

content.value: Hong chose to utilise sheer curtains from our Allusion range in colour Limestone.
What was the initial brief like for Witta Circle and how much collaboration goes into a big project like this, so you can achieve the perfect look?

This project took a year to complete. We started with all the architectural plans and built it up from there. The brief was to keep everything minimal. Not too many cushions or anything like that – often cushions are overused by designers to make everything look “soft”, but it can make a house cluttered. That wasn’t what we wanted here.

We wanted to match the interiors to the elements outside – the water and the garden. We wanted to keep it light. Natural. Airy. Very minimal. We wanted minimal furniture and made choices based on creating contrast against the main material, concrete. So, we chose fabrics that were natural, allowing the décor to complement the natural environment. We wanted to let the amazing architecture speak for itself.

contentBlocks.title: "The linen-look was perfect, it matched well with the colour of the walls, all the elements of the room and was consistent with the idea of keeping everything light, natural, and airy."

content.value: The open, indoor/outdoor living is such an amazing feature of this property. Then, of course, being able to close off spaces is so integral. From an Interior Designer’s perspective, why were sheer curtains from our Allusion range the right choice to be incorporated in certain spaces? And talk us through choosing to utilise motorisation or not?

We chose double sheer curtains in the media room because the texture and the flexibility of filtering the right light was so important. It means you don’t get the sun’s glare on the TV screen, but it also doesn’t take away from the view out to the pool. The linen-look was perfect, it matched well with the colour of the walls, all the elements of the room and was consistent with the idea of keeping everything light, natural, and airy.
We motorised the master bedroom for convenience but didn’t with the media room, as the client didn’t want too much automation for the kids!

The style is so earthy with lots of wood, stone, and greenery - parts of the house look like a modern-day oasis! How do you go about finding inspiration, creating a theme, and tracking down the ideal pieces that complement the architecture?

As an Interior Designer, I’m involved from the very beginning. So, what we do is we work with the architect and then meet with the client to get a clear idea of what they want. Then we start to go to shops, pick out pieces and render a 3D version of the home, so they can see how the couch will match with the rug for example. From there, there’s a lot of back and forth, but that’s just so we can create the perfect look.

With Witta Circle, we didn’t want to mess with the architecture, so we paired it back. Nothing is over-the-top. Nothing is invasive or too jarring. It’s clean. It’s neat. It’s modern. Obviously, we don’t want to surprise anyone with any bold choices, we want to ensure that our clients are happy when they walk through the door.

contentBlocks.title: "Sheers were utilised to filter light nicely and created the perfect amount of texture."

content.value: Obviously, the warmer climate plays a big role in the layout and style of this project. Are there any practical design aspects that you had to think about in terms of how the weather there might affect living at Witta Circle?

The front façade of the house was equipped with an external screen that was able to provide protection from the heat and provided privacy, where the sheers were utilised to filter light nicely and created the perfect amount of texture. In the bedrooms, we doubled-up with blockouts, as they’re ideal to make it dark at night-time for sleeping, plus will help keep the rooms cool.

contentBlocks.title: "That first moment, when they opened the door and started running from room to room – it was amazing. The squeals from the kids. The delight. Their reactions. That’s the most satisfying part for me."

content.value: The design is wonderful with such purpose in how every space feels creative, open yet intimate and completely liveable at the same time. We just love so many different aspects about this home but what was it about the finished product that you found to be the most satisfying?

We often style homes that aren’t lived in by the clients. It’s a really special feeling when they come and see it for the first time. This project was set up for Christmas, so we had a Christmas tree up and everything. That first moment, when they opened the door and started running from room to room – it was amazing. The squeals from the kids. The delight. Their reactions. That’s the most satisfying part for me.

Hong, we love your style so much. We love what you achieved with Witta Circle. How can we see what you’re up to and have you got any other projects in the future that are going to be as amazing as this one? We can’t wait to see more!
You can follow me on Instagram @honghenwooddesign and we have started a new company, Archend - you can find out more about us at
archend.co

. This new business allows us to be involved from start to finish. From construction to building and interior design. We have some big projects coming up, plus another with architect Shaun Lockyer who we worked with on Witta Circle.
I feel like we’re fully booked for the next few years but I seem to keep taking more on!?

title: Chamberlain Property chose sheers, blockout roller blinds and PolyLux® shutters for two luxury townhouses

contentBlocks.title: Chamberlain Property opted for glamorous sheers, blockout roller blinds and PolyLux® shutters in their two luxurious family townhouse developments in Templestowe.
"Our Templestowe townhouses are architect-designed family homes, blending functionality with luxury."

content.value: For more incredible content, check out our
Templestowe townhouses home tour.
Hi Jess, we loved collaborating with you on your two incredible Templestowe townhouse developments. How would you describe the project?

Our Templestowe townhouses are architect-designed family homes, blending functionality with luxury. They feel high-end thanks to bespoke details like our custom joinery, designer lighting and made-to-measure window furnishings.

We designed two completely different floorplans and unique looks for the townhouses. We find it hard to decide which townhouse we love best! Templestowe Townhouse 1 is light and airy, with crisp white walls, natural stone and hardwood finishes. One of the standout details is the curved bench seat in the kitchen, which is upholstered in a beautiful Warwick fabric. We love the luxurious textures of the terrazzo floor tiles, concrete basins and gunmetal tapware in the bathrooms.

Townhouse 2 has a bold green kitchen, soothing grey tones and brass accents for warmth. It features our favourite family bathroom. We adore the different greys of the stone and tiles, juxtaposed with the brass tapware and lighting. It’s bathroom bliss!

contentBlocks.title: "Outdoor aspect is really important to us in a build, and we love incorporating greenery. We decided to plant as early as possible during construction, which was great advice from BuildHer Collective."

content.value: Both homes have magnificent oversized windows and private outdoor areas. How important are outside spaces and greenery in your townhouse developments?

Outdoor aspect is really important to us in a build, and we love incorporating greenery. We decided to plant as early as possible during construction, which was great advice from BuildHer Collective. We trained jasmine plants up the wall in the courtyard. They cut through the neutral colour palette, and when spring comes around they will fill the outdoor space with gorgeous scents.

contentBlocks.title: "Don’t underestimate how premium window furnishings can completely lift a space. They’re great value and a cost-efficient way to make an impact."

content.value: What impact do you think custom DIY Blinds window furnishings have in your project?

Don’t underestimate how premium window furnishings can completely lift a space. They’re great value and a cost-efficient way to make an impact. They are such an amazing investment. We would not do another build project without including window furnishings.

Our linen sheers add laidback drama in the kitchen and living spaces, and they create a warm, cosy vibe in the bedrooms. They truly are the hero window furnishing. Not only do our curtains look amazing, but they feel lovely to touch, and you can tell they are great quality, Aussie-made curtains.

contentBlocks.title: "Our sheers help prospective buyers feel an emotional connection with the homes, especially in the hero spaces. They are a fantastic choice if you’re building to sell."

content.value: How do your window furnishings enhance light and mood in the townhouses?

Natural light is one of our favourite features in the townhouses, thanks to our oversized windows. Our sheers filter daylight beautifully and add a lovely softness to the spaces, without darkening the rooms at all. They also provide daytime privacy when needed. Our sheers help prospective buyers feel an emotional connection with the homes, especially in the hero spaces. They are a fantastic choice if you’re building to sell. They take the townhouses to another level.

Our blockout roller blinds and PolyLux® shutters completely block light, which helps the homes feel super cosy and private at night. They are also fantastic for thermal insulation on cold Melbourne nights. We love our sheers + blockout roller blinds combo. We can see why it’s a really popular product combination with DIY Blinds customers.

contentBlocks.title: "We incorporated generously wide hallways, which feel totally luxurious. They create an instant wow factor when you walk in the front door."

content.value: Can you tell us about other bespoke details in the townhouses, in addition to your custom window furnishings?

We chose ceiling-height mirrors and added skylights throughout the homes, to create a feeling of spaciousness and for maximum natural light. We incorporated generously wide hallways, which feel totally luxurious. They create an instant wow factor when you walk in the front door. It’s important to make a great first impression with potential buyers viewing the property.

contentBlocks.title: "Having the DIY Blinds professional installation team come out to install our window furnishings in one day was fantastic."

content.value: Do you have any advice for building a network of people, suppliers and trades you can trust?

We really value developing great relationships with everyone in our team. It takes time and effort to build solid relationships, but it means you can trust the advice you’re given. It helps take some of the stress out of decision-making, when you know you’re dealing with really experienced and knowledgeable people.

Having the DIY Blinds professional installation team come out to install our window furnishings in one day was fantastic. Not only was it a fun experience, but we learned a lot about the install process and got to know the installation team personally.

We have also met some incredible people through BuildHer Collective. We could not have achieved as much as we did with our Templestowe projects, without their support. I became a #DevelopHer two years ago. I got to know some super talented people through the DevelopHer masterclass, like our style consultant Rachel Collard who helped us select our finishes. BuildHer Collective provides a platform for women who are developing property to share their achievements and learnings, ask questions and connect with each other. It’s amazing.

contentBlocks.title: "We are currently working full-time on a number of townhouse development projects across Melbourne, including in Middle Footscray and Doncaster."

content.value: Can you let us in on any new development projects Chamberlain Property is currently doing?

We are currently working full-time on a number of townhouse development projects across Melbourne, including in Middle Footscray and Doncaster. Our Doncaster project is three townhouses, which have been designed as three distinct, sophisticated homes. We can’t wait to share our development journeys!

contentBlocks.title: Watch our home tour video to see more of the Templestowe townhouses!

title: The Eyrie: A gorgeous tiny house featuring combined recess and face-fit roller blinds to maximise space, privacy and views

contentBlocks.title: The Eyrie is a tiny house with designer touches and incredible mountain views. Combined recess and face-fit roller blinds have minimal projection. They maximise space, light, privacy, views and thermal insulation.
"We spoke a lot about living in a smaller home on a big property one day. It’s only been in the last 18 months that we started seriously considering the reality of living in a tiny house on wheels."

content.value: Julia chose face-fit blockout roller blinds from our Jersey BO range, colour Stone BO, and recess-fit sunscreen roller blinds from our Solar View range, colour White.

Hi Julia, congratulations on moving into your incredible new home! We have loved working with you on your window furnishing selections. Was it always your dream to escape the city and build a tiny house in the country?

Thank you! For sure. Josh and I both grew up in the country and always felt very connected to the land, so as much as we loved city life, there was definitely something missing. We spoke a lot about living in a smaller home on a big property one day. It’s only been in the last 18 months that we started seriously considering the reality of living in a tiny house on wheels.

Like so many people, our plans for the last two years went out the window once COVID-19 hit. We had just left our jobs and home in Melbourne to start a 12-month caravan trip around Australia when the borders started closing. It just wasn’t the right time to travel. So we started thinking about ways we could create a home base for ourselves on Gumbaynggirr Land, on the Mid North Coast of New South Wales, without the pressure of a mortgage. Once we started researching, including bingeing the Living Big in a Tiny House YouTube channel, we were hooked!

contentBlocks.title: "Having a smaller space also makes us more conscious about the items we buy. It’s totally curbed my desire to make impulse shopping purchases! Now everything we own, we love."

content.value: What do you think are the major benefits of living in a tiny house? Do you have more downtime without a big property to look after?

There are so many benefits! Yes, from a day-to-day standpoint, tiny houses are easy to clean and maintain. A few minutes a day does the trick. I’ve also never lived in such a nice, new house, so that’s been a real treat. But the best part of downscaling has been the lifestyle that comes with it. I started my own business just over a year ago, and I don’t think I would have been game to do it with the pressure of Melbourne rent prices or a mortgage. Owning our home means I make bolder business choices and our lifestyle centres around the way we want to live, rather than trying to make ends meet.

And whilst it’s not an investment in the same way that a traditional home is, the cost is similar to what we would have paid in rent over five years in Melbourne. Now we have a place of our own and can take it with us wherever we go. And if we do ever sell it, we’ll have a nice house deposit ready to go.

Another huge benefit of living tiny is sustainability. Our house, ‘The Eyrie’, is completely off-grid which is great for the environment and means no more bills. It feels good knowing we are living more gently. Having a smaller space also makes us more conscious about the items we buy. It’s totally curbed my desire to make impulse shopping purchases! Now everything we own, we love.

contentBlocks.title: "A benefit of having a smaller footprint is that creating a luxury space is way more affordable."

content.value: Can you offer any design advice for people building or renovating their own home with a very small footprint?

Firstly, it’s super exciting! Just because it’s small doesn’t mean it won’t be incredible. A benefit of having a smaller footprint is that creating a luxury space is way more affordable. You only need a small amount of each item so you can afford to get your dream blinds, carpet, flooring, etc. That is pretty neat.

I’m a total design rookie so I don’t know what advice I can give, but I can tell you about the mistakes we made. We stuffed up a lot early on buying furniture, sinks and tapware that just looked too big for the space. Just because something can fit in there, doesn’t mean it should! It doesn’t matter how lovely a basin is, if it’s taking up the whole vanity it’s going to ruin the vibe. Leave some breathing room and if you can, make sure each item has a dual purpose. For example, our couch folds into a double bed in about five seconds, and the chaise lifts up into a storage box. Game changer for movie nights! That being said, there’s some things that shouldn’t be so tiny – showers, beds, cooktops and fridges – so choose wisely.

There’s no escaping mistakes in a smaller space, so make sure you get the details right the first time. The extra space in bigger rooms can distract from flaws as there’s more to look at, but you’ll notice everything in a smaller space. I can tell you where every painting fail in our house is, and I do wish we had done a better job the first time!

contentBlocks.title: "The blinds have completely changed the feel of our home! In such a small space, having window coverings with minimal projection into the room is so important."

content.value: Your sunscreen and blockout roller blinds in a combined recess fit and face fit are a great space saving option. Their projection into the room is really minimised. Tell us about how the blinds enhance your home, and what you love most about them.
The blinds have completely changed the feel of our home! In such a small space, having window coverings with minimal projection into the room is so important.

Our whole house is open space, so we need to block out light at night and show off the view during the day. I was really worried about how bulky most coverings would look. When Ashley from DIY Blinds suggested a combination of face fit and recess fit blinds, we knew it was the perfect solution.

The face fit blockout blinds do such a good job of keeping our open loft bedroom very dark at night. The recess fit sunscreen blinds let us appreciate the view while cutting out glare during the day. They’ve turned out so much better than expected. With 10 windows and a glass door, I thought I might get sick of opening and closing the blinds each morning and night, but I actually love it! There’s something very ritualistic about letting in the day each morning, seeing what the sky brings, setting your intentions, and taking time to appreciate each part of your home.

contentBlocks.title: "We were very conscious about creating a light and airy home, so we may have gone overboard with the windows. We’ve definitely got more windows than wall space!"

content.value: Windows are literally a massive feature in your home, and they are amazing at connecting the home with nature and those fabulous views. Were large windows always a big part of your brief?
Absolutely! We were very conscious about creating a light and airy home, so we may have gone overboard with the windows.

We’ve definitely got more windows than wall space! There’s no place in the house where you can’t see multiple viewpoints outside and it really makes our house seem bigger than it is. It has made it difficult to find homes for our art though.

contentBlocks.title: "I sent Ashley from DIY Blinds photos of all 10 windows. She worked through them with me one by one to confirm how each would fit. By the end of the process I felt confident they would all work, and they have!"

content.value: How did you find the DIY process of measuring up your windows, and ordering and installing your roller blinds?

Well to start, I was pretty terrified of doing the measurements for the blinds and ended up measuring them three times myself and twice with Josh. I’m glad I did because every window was different, even the ones that were supposed to be the same.

We have some complicated window frames. For example, our lounge windows don’t have full frames on the top as they hit the bottom of our bedroom loft. I sent Ashley from DIY Blinds photos of all 10 windows. She worked through them with me one by one to confirm how each would fit. By the end of the process I felt confident they would all work, and they have! Installing the blinds was a piece of cake.

Ashley absolutely went above and beyond to help us. I genuinely couldn't believe how much time she spent answering our questions, giving advice, and sending us example photos. I was hesitant about ordering something so big over the phone/email and she made it so much easier. I've no idea how she managed to explain complicated blind fastenings over the phone in a way that we could understand, but she did.

contentBlocks.title: "Our home is completely off-grid, which means we have a very low carbon footprint and no bills to pay!"

content.value: Your blockout roller blinds are fantastic thermal insulation, and can help reduce heating and cooling costs, while sunscreen roller blinds help block UV rays, glare and heat. Can you tell us about other solutions you chose to reduce your home’s carbon footprint?
Our blockout roller blinds really are brilliant for insulation; we definitely notice a difference on cold winter nights.

Our home is completely off-grid, which means we have a very low carbon footprint and no bills to pay! Our electricity is all solar-generated and stored in batteries, and these are powerful enough to run all of our appliances including an air-conditioner. We use gas for cooking and hot water, and catch water in a big rainwater tank. We also have a waterless, composting toilet system, which is brilliant. It’s nothing like the drop loos of yesteryear; it’s super slick, smell-free and easy to use. Plus we aren’t wasting precious water resources just to flush and treat our waste, which is insane once you start thinking about it.

contentBlocks.title: "I’m looking forward to finishing the inside of the tiny house and getting stuck into landscaping. So prepare for a whole lot of tiny house spam, I’d say!"

content.value: Now that you’re settled into your home, what exciting things can we hope to see from you in future?

At this stage, who knows?! We still haven’t given up on the idea of some epic Australian adventures but we’re happy staying close to home for now. I’m looking forward to finishing the inside of the tiny house and getting stuck into landscaping. So prepare for a whole lot of tiny house spam, I’d say!

title: 123 Clarke: a charismatic designer home featuring luxe sheers and hints of drama

contentBlocks.title: 123 Clarke is the latest project by DevelopHer Yolanda. The renovated Federation-style family home oozes charisma, and features sheer linen curtains throughout.
"123 Clarke is a pretty special house, and I’m very proud of the outcome."

content.value: For more incredible content, jump across to watch our
home tour at 123 Clarke

Hi Yolanda, congratulations on the recent sale of your incredible development project and family home, 123 Clarke! Our DIY Blinds design consultants loved working closely with you to design your window furnishings.
Thanks team! It was a pretty special house, and I’m very proud of the outcome. Thanks very much for all your support, and for being a part of the journey that was 123 Clarke!
When did you first discover your passion for developing properties?

My passion for property development is a natural progression from my love of real estate and architecture. But I must say that to undertake a renovation or build a new home, you have to have a fairly thick skin and broad shoulders!

I really enjoy renovating homes and I find it helpful to have a passion and hobby to channel my time and energy into, outside my career in healthcare. Each project is a starry constellation of wins, losses and lessons learnt, and is a great tool for demonstrating the importance of values within the next generation. If you are lucky enough to be able to join all the dots, you can end up with quite a beautiful picture as a result. After all, who doesn’t love a good rollercoaster right?

contentBlocks.title: "My advice for aspiring renovators and people designing their forever home is seek the advice of professionals who share your passion and enthusiasm."

content.value: Do you have any advice for finding trustworthy and collaborative suppliers and trades, when renovating or developing for the first time?

My advice for aspiring renovators and people designing their forever home is seek the advice of professionals who share your passion and enthusiasm. You must not only love a product, you should love the people you are dealing with. A high-performance team of champions who share your vision will always lend itself to the best outcome for your home.

This build has definitely been the longest, most challenging of any I have ever completed. I think the results are truly unique. It has been a massive undertaking, and I have had a lot of fun along the way. I often think to myself what a disaster it would have been, if I had not found myself in the company of this very special group of trades and suppliers.

Forging long-standing relationships with suppliers like DIY Blinds means that not only do I intend to work with them again in future, but these interactions now transcend into personal friendships. A support network of people to share the wins, and problem-solve through the trickier times. I’ve lost count of the amount of times I discussed the window furnishing options with DIY Blinds staff!

contentBlocks.title: "We incorporated playful elements like an open mezzanine to encourage more interaction across the ground and first floors."

content.value: When designing a family-friendly home, what key elements do you think people should consider in their plans?

Everyone's design brief is very personal, and specific to their family. Our brief was to create a family home, with a hint of drama. We wanted zoned living and sleeping quarters, with spaces to come together and spaces to be apart. Due to our sloping block, we ended up with a beautiful terraced design, where old meets new style home.

It's important to have some separation between sleeping and living quarters in this day and age. And who isn’t a fan of a large open-plan living/dining/kitchen that connects seamlessly to the garden and pool, if you’re lucky enough to have the budget for it!

Considering the age of any kids is important too, so they feel engaged with the home. We incorporated playful elements like an open mezzanine to encourage more interaction across the ground and first floors.

Hands down, our best investment would have to be the in-ground trampoline. It’s definitely one of the best motivational tools in our arsenal to peel the kids away from their screens. It took a lot of effort to excavate, and has its own in-ground plumbing. Like most things in the house, the devil is in the details. It’s often the things that are made to look effortless, which take the most effort!

contentBlocks.title: "As soon as I had my initial house plans, I sent them to Evan at DIY Blinds who was able to workshop ideas with me. We also worked to fit everything within my budget."

content.value: Can you share your top tips for choosing window furnishings?

My top tip is to engage the design professionals from the get-go. Choosing between shutters, blinds and curtains was a tricky enough design decision. Then having to navigate between sheers and blockouts, ceiling mount or face fit, S fold versus pleats, motorisation, and so on. Not to mention the endless array of fabrics and styles!

As soon as I had my initial house plans, I sent them to Evan at DIY Blinds who was able to workshop ideas with me. Quite often window furnishings are the unsung hero that gets ‘forgotten’ at the design stage, and are left to the very end. Which is such a shame, as they are such an important element to add to the look and feel of the home.

Evan did multiple site visits to ensure we had considered all aspects of form and function, before anything went into production. We also worked to fit everything within my budget, which is quite helpful in the development game to maximise bang for your buck.

contentBlocks.title: "From the first moment I received my samples from DIY Blinds, I knew that the Allusion range would be right for this house. The price point of the sheers is so great."

content.value: What drew you to linen sheers from our Allusion range, and what do you love most about them?

From the first moment I received my samples from DIY Blinds, I knew that the Allusion range would be right for this house. Linen sheers have a super luxe feel to them. The price point of the sheers is so great; I know they will pay dividends when it comes to making a big impact at resale.

I was torn between two different colours. After speaking with a DIY Blinds consultant, I knew that one would work better and play on the green and warm beige undertones of this house. We chose a colour called Marzipan. It’s a beautiful soft pink/beige that specifically works to endorse the feminine vibes within each space.
What do you look for when choosing great value, premium quality products like our DIY Blinds designer curtains?

That old saying ‘you get what you pay for’ is certainly true as far as I’m concerned. When you develop for profit, you inherently want to look for the lowest price, because you are always weary of overcapitalising.

I think DIY Blinds have been making waves in the window furnishings space, because they have found innovative ways to bring down the price of a product, while delivering a high quality. By not having showrooms and not paying commissions to salespeople, they can pass savings on to customers. That is fantastic news for people who are on a tight budget, and for those who don’t want to compromise on a premium product. Their window furnishings are also Australian made. As well as getting a quick turn-around time on manufacturing, you know you’re supporting local. That, to me, is a huge win!

contentBlocks.title: "I was adamant about including colour within the house. You don’t often see colour in developments, especially organic greens like the ones we used in the bedrooms."

content.value: 123 Clarke is unique and full of personality, while still appealing to lots of potential buyers. How do you strike that balance so well with your developments?
Design is a very personal thing. Too far one way, you’re going to come off as a rebel and haphazard; too far in the other direction and it becomes too vanilla.

At 123 Clarke the angles, curves and brass inlays are repeated, even in the outdoor areas, to achieve a consistent, high-end look and feel throughout the home. I was adamant about including colour within the house, which you don’t often see in developments, especially organic greens like the ones we used in the bedrooms.

The use of natural stone throughout the house is a crowd favourite. Because of the price point, maintenance and availability of engineered stone these days, it’s becoming far more common in the residential setting. I’ve said it before and I’ll say it again, you just can’t beat the look of natural stone. You will find a lot of it in this house, because there is nothing more luxurious than a stunning piece of marble atop a custom piece of joinery.

The folded-steel stairs are something quite exquisite, and not often seen in residential homes. They seem to float in mid-air, and look more like a sculpture than a staircase. Ironically, despite it being suspended, it weighs just over half a tonne, and took several people hours to erect. Wow moments like this throughout the house means it will likely resonate with people. After all with great risk comes great reward!

contentBlocks.title: "It was a pleasure and an achievement to return this house to its original glory and bring it into the modern day, so it can be enjoyed for generations to come."

content.value: What were the main challenges you faced during this project?

Unfortunately, like most other people who were building last year, we were severely impacted by the COVID-19 situation. We encountered reduced workforce numbers, unavailability of labour, travel restrictions, delayed and cancelled orders and paucity of stock and materials, not to mention numerous shutdowns. All of these things stretched our budgets and timelines, but they made us appreciate the final outcome more. They also brought the team closer together. Nothing strengthens the sense of camaraderie quite like adversity!

contentBlocks.title: "We loved renovating and extending this beautiful 1920s Federation-style home, which was hidden under a not-so-beautiful 1980s renovation."

content.value: What did you enjoy most about renovating a Federation-style period home?

We loved renovating and extending this beautiful 1920s Federation-style home, which was hidden under a not-so-beautiful 1980s renovation. I think I most enjoyed uncovering the history of the house as we peeled back each layer. We discovered old photos and original period features that have been hidden for decades. One by one the old wire-cut mission brown bricks were removed to reveal the original roughcast render, which we restored based on historical photos. It was a pleasure and an achievement to return this house to its original glory and bring it into the modern day, so it can be enjoyed for generations to come.
Are you able to let us in on any projects you have planned for the rest of this year?

Life in general has been very tricky to navigate throughout Covid, and real estate is no exception! 123 Clarke was a huge project that took almost 3 years from purchase to completion, so (for now) we are taking a well-deserved break. I’m sure it won’t be long before we circle back to get in line for the renovation rollercoaster once more!

contentBlocks.title: Watch our home tour video to hear Yolanda talk about her incredible home!

title: ARCOS by Graya: a Mediterranean villa-inspired home featuring motorised blinds and designer curtains

contentBlocks.title: Meet Arcos. A jaw-dropping Brisbane home by Graya and Joe Adsett Architects. It features luxe sheers and motorised roller blinds from our great value online range.

content.value: Arcos is a Mediterranean villa-inspired home and just a few kilometres from Brisbane's CBD. Arcos means
arches

in Spanish, and this home has curves galore. We're simply in love with how Graya, a high-end design and construction firm, and Joe Adsett Architecture have honoured the original Queenslander property that was on this corner block. It was carefully lifted up two levels, and now sits majestically at the top of this new, state-of-the-art home.

The result is a spacious family home that's perfect for entertaining friends and family. It features a breathtaking pool, generous backyard and incredible details like the curved central staircase and dramatic arched entrance.
A touch of luxury at home

Rob Gray chose premium quality linen sheers and motorised blockout roller blinds for Arcos. They look spectacular in this high-end home. But we also cater for customers doing modest builds and renovations at the other end of the scale.

You can have a touch of luxury at home, regardless of whether you're renovating on a budget or you have a limitless budget! In both scenarios you'll enjoy the same great value window furnishings, quality workmanship, designer fabrics, customer service and incredible results. What's not to love about that?

contentBlocks.title: For effortless privacy and thermal insulation Rob and Meghan installed Somfy-powered motorised blockout roller blinds

content.value: The street-facing sitting room at Arcos features floor-to-ceiling sheers from our Allusion range, colour linen. For effortless luxury, privacy and thermal insulation, Rob and Meghan installed Somfy-powered motorised blockout roller blinds behind their sheers.

The motorised blockout roller blinds are from our Balmoral range, which is fantastic for thermal insulation all year round. In winter they stop heat escaping and block cold draughts. In summer they reflect the harsh Aussie sun and help keep your home cool. Somfy-powered motorisation uses premium technology and can be integrated into your smart home. The Somfy Connexoon Window RTS Hub enables your blinds to respond to your routine and the weather, and can be paired with home automation devices like Amazon Alexa and Google Home.

contentBlocks.title: We're disrupting the blinds industry by making it quick and easy to buy great value blinds online

content.value: We're disrupting the blinds industry by making it quick and easy to buy great value designer blinds online. All our customers love how simple our end-to-end process, from ordering free samples through to DIY installing. It's why we can offer such great value compared to traditional bricks and mortar retailers. And because we're Australian-made, we’re able to deliver high quality window furnishings at more affordable prices and with faster delivery.

Rob and Meghan carefully researched and planned all their furniture and material choices, including their window furnishings. The linen sheers add a soft, relaxed feel and perfectly complement the warm, neutral colour palette. The result is dreamy. To find your perfect blind fabric,
order your free samples
and we'll priority-post them to you. When they arrive, sticky tape them to your windows and observe how they look at different times of the day.

contentBlocks.title: The sheer curtains at Arcos filter sunlight, let in the gentle Brisbane breeze and are soft and tactile

content.value: The sheers at Arcos filter sunlight and let in the gentle Brisbane breeze. It was important for Rob and Meghan to have a strong connection with the outdoors and to create flow from the living space into their sub-tropical backyard.

The sheers are soft and tactile and invite you to approach the windows and walk out onto the terrace. They diffuse the bright sunlight and add texture to the minimalist living spaces. They stack easily to the side when the couple wants to enjoy their amazing city views.

title: Three Gables: Sheer linen curtains soften this exquisite monochromatic home

contentBlocks.title: Sheer linen curtains add drama and softness to the perfectly monochromatic design of Taf and Bree's new home, Three Gables.
"Three Gables is a home balancing imperfect and natural finishes with sleek and refined elements."

content.value: Congrats on your incredible new home, Three Gables! We’re crazy about the monochromatic design that you and Kate Lawrence Interiors collaborated on. What vision did you set out to achieve?

Thank you! We love minimalist, simple forms, and raw, natural materials. Our vision was for the essential and necessary components of our home to be the design features. The curved walls, raked ceilings and hardwood cladding are the talking points and set the tone for the design. As do the kitchen cabinetry, bench top, fireplace and window furnishings, which were all carefully considered and executed using quality materials.
We were also deeply passionate about building a home that requires minimal styling and clutter. We set out to design a home that doesn't need a lot of extras added to look styled.
As much as we wanted to do something different, Three Gables needed to feel like a home and have broad popularity. This was important given its location within a new residential estate.
How do you describe the unique look of Three Gables?
Three Gables is a home balancing imperfect and natural finishes with sleek and refined elements. Hard surfaces such as concrete and timber are softened by tactile fabrics like our
sheer linen curtains
. Greys and neutrals add warmth to the black and white design. I think the balance of these contrasting materials and colours is what makes Three Gables stand out.

contentBlocks.title: "Because this is the first home we designed and built just for us, we wanted to be super hands-on and do as much as we could ourselves."

content.value: Tell us a bit about TrueBuild Homes, the business Taf and his business partner Eddy run.

We’re a boutique building company specialising in custom, architect-designed homes, duplexes, renovations and extensions across all of Sydney and up to Newcastle. Eddy and I are co-directors and great mates with high-end carpentry backgrounds. We both have a passion for innovative design and construction, and for sharing the journey with our clients.
Did it feel different building your own home compared to other homes TrueBuild has done?

Because this is the first home we designed and built just for us, we wanted to be super hands-on and do as much as we could ourselves. I went back to being full-time on the tools for this project, and spent my afternoons, evenings and weekends on it. I also roped Bree into helping me out, and it was super fun having her assist me on the tools. We had to work around our work schedules, which meant a lot of late nights and long weekends spent here. We lived off our local Margarita pizza, wine and beer with no time for home cooking.

It was obviously very different building as a couple, rather than for a client. The freedom to make changes without having to wait for owner approval was refreshing! On the other side, Bree and I didn't always have a lot of patience for each other. Our neighbours wouldn’t have appreciated our occasional yelling matches. Sorry neighbours! But we're so grateful we got to build our home together and we're thrilled with what we've achieved.

contentBlocks.title: "Our sheer linen curtains play a massive role in softening the space, adding drama and bringing everything together."

content.value: We’re blown away by your luxe material choices: premium timber floors, venetian plaster walls and linen curtains, to name just a few. How important are quality materials to you?

Huge! The materials we chose create the energy of the house. As well as quality building materials, we chose to value a few core material selections to form the foundation of our home e.g. timber, concrete, wool and linen.
Our
sheer linen curtains

play a massive role in softening the space, adding drama and bringing everything together. The pale grey sheers complement the contrasting black and white colour palette, and they look incredible against harder surfaces like the timber, concrete and even the wool.

Good architectural design and the selection of quality materials define the home. Nailing the core materials allows you to create a space that's authentic, cost-effective and high-end without spending unnecessary money in every area. You don’t need to spend ridiculous money to have a beautiful home!

contentBlocks.title: "Window furnishings complete a home and need to have more importance within the building industry, not just the styling and decorating industry."

content.value: We’d love to know how early you started planning for your window furnishings and the process you went through. We always tell our customers the earlier the better, especially for high end features like built-in curtain pelmets.

Wall-to-wall and floor-to-ceiling curtains were always going to be a huge part of our home, given our large windows and our focus on natural light. Being able to filter the light through sheers and soften the space was important.

We started planning our window furnishings and recessed pelmets at the floor plan design stage. We wanted privacy and needed to allow adequate pelmet depths for both sheer curtain tracks and blockout roller blinds. Recessed pelmets are simple and an often unnoticed design feature, but they give a huge impact on the overall feel of the
sheers
Window furnishings complete a home and need to have more importance within the building industry, not just the styling and decorating industry.
You chose sheer linen curtains from our Allusion range, colour Silver. What are your top tips for choosing the perfect curtain fabric?
Keep it simple and neutral. Sheer curtains are already a huge statement, so we recommend going for a fabric that doesn’t overpower the rest of the home.
Choose a texture you're already using in your home. Our home is full of natural materials including linen, so
linen sheers
were an obvious choice.
Link your curtain colour with your furniture and carpet fabrics, to make the connection with the rest of the house.
We had our good friend and amazing interior designer, Kate Lawrence, work alongside us. She helped refine all our finishes to ensure everything flowed effortlessly.

contentBlocks.title: "We can control our motorised blinds from our phones, without having to move rooms. The fully customisable options like the timer, the weather settings and routine-based programming are amazing."

content.value: You layered motorised blockout blinds behind your sheers for effortless luxury. What are your favourite things about motorised blinds?
We love the convenience of not having to get off the lounge! We can control all our
motorised blinds
from our phones, without having to move rooms. The fully customisable options like the timer, the weather settings and the daily routine-based programming are amazing.
There is something so satisfying about watching the smoothness of the blinds moving themselves. It feels so high-end and such a talking point of our home.
Can you let us in on what’s next for TrueBuild Homes and Three Gables?

TrueBuild Homes has some exciting architecturally designed new homes and duplexes coming up. We always look to be innovative and to improve our methods. We'll continue to design and build simple forms and healthy and considered homes for people to love living in!

In terms of Three Gables, we are currently in the middle of finishing our landscaping and pool. Our home has a big focus on the outdoor living experience, so we'll be enjoying that with friends and family.
We are already so excited and eager to start our next project, which is coming very soon!

title: Linen sheers work their magic in Zephyr + Stone's designer homes

contentBlocks.title: Sheers add a touch of magic in these serene designer homes by Zephyr + Stone. Meet the women behind these incredible projects.
"Our website is a resource hub packed with valuable information we share from our own development projects"

content.value: Hi Ania and Kasia! Can you please describe your wonderful business, Zephyr + Stone?
Sure! We launched Zephyr + Stone four years ago. We’re an interior design studio, but also a multi-faceted business.
Our website

is a resource hub packed with valuable information we share from our own development projects, including building and design tools, free tips sheets, and trend and product information. We really endeavour to answer questions individuals wouldn’t think to ask, so they can avoid problems and achieve a designer look and finish in their own homes. We also have an
online store
with a curated range of beautiful furniture, and we work with clients directly providing bespoke interior design and furniture selection.

contentBlocks.title: "We really endeavour to answer questions individuals wouldn’t think to ask, so they can avoid problems and achieve a designer look and finish in their own homes."

content.value: You share the most practical tips and tricks for designing and planning projects. What is your number one piece of advice for someone starting their first build or reno?
Our number one piece of advice is to research, plan and get organised as much as possible before starting any work. You want to avoid having to make last-minute decisions onsite.

If you’re planning to tackle some DIY, make sure you speak to experts or educate yourself with a short course. Mistakes are often very expensive, or you could end up with a finish that you’re not happy with! If you don’t have any hands-on experience, we recommend engaging qualified contractors for a first project. Watch and learn as much as you can, rather than attempting things yourself.

contentBlocks.title: "We design quality homes that are uncomplicated, open, cohesive, and always flooded with as much natural light as possible."

content.value: Would you say you have a signature style? All your projects feel amazingly cohesive and balanced.

Rather than having a signature style, we design quality homes that are uncomplicated, open, cohesive, and always flooded with as much natural light as possible. We always choose finishes to appeal to 80% of potential buyers and we don’t follow trends, as we look to create neutral, timeless homes that will age gracefully.
Balance and space are paramount in every floor plan and design, and we generally don’t design individual spaces without first ensuring the floor plan is completely maximised.

Two of your recent projects, Scandi Townhouse and Coastal 2Ways, are complete Instagram sensations. We get so many comments from our community about them! Can you share how they came together and your roles on the projects?

These projects were our own developments and are among our favourites to date! We designed all aspects ourselves including floor plans, finishes, cabinetry, colours and furniture styling, and we were onsite most days to oversee the design details. Each project evolved from an original concept, and grew as finishes were finalised.

The #Coastal2Ways project is a duplex with two identical floor plans. We used different colour schemes and finishes to showcase two different ways you can achieve a coastal look in your home. One has a classic colour palette with timber, white and more natural finishes, whilst the other is more contemporary with cleaner and more minimal lines, panelled cabinetry and pale grey tiled floors.

contentBlocks.title: "We love how sheers work their magic to instantly make a room feel complete."

content.value: Floor-to-ceiling S fold sheers are a great value way to create a timeless designer look and transform a home. What do you love most about your sheers?

Even with the most beautiful hard finishes and a healthy project budget, a space just doesn’t feel complete without texture and soft furnishings. We love how sheers work their magic to instantly make a room feel complete. They soften and filter light, provide good privacy by day and give our homes that designer look.

You chose linen sheers from our Allusion range, colour Snow, as well as motorised blockout roller blinds for effortless luxury. Can you offer advice to help our customers choose the perfect fabric for curtains and blinds?

To choose the right fabric, start by looking at what you’re hoping to achieve. That might be privacy, blocking out light or purely aesthetics. Then consider which solution will work best in relation to the type of window or door you’ll be covering. Don’t be afraid to choose fabrics with a bit of texture, colour or detail, as these will feel soft and luxurious and can have a more sophisticated effect compared to a flat colour or fabric.

contentBlocks.title: "Planning window furnishings is essential before you sign off on your construction drawings!"

content.value: You share our passion for planning ahead to get the best results. At what stage of a project do you start planning your window furnishings?

Planning window furnishings is essential before you sign off on your construction drawings! We plan our window furnishings when our floor plans or home concepts are being finalised to ensure every window and space is maximised.

Window furnishings can seem like something that comes at the end of a project, however it’s vital to consider them before or during early construction stages. This is so you can allow for any labour required to achieve your design. It's especially important if you’re hoping to conceal blind fixings or curtain tracks in a recess or bulkhead.
Are you able to tell us anything about the upcoming launch of Z + S Design Academy? We’re excited!

The Z + S Design Academy will be an invaluable resource for those tackling home design or DIY projects. It will provide them with a space to get advice and feedback from ourselves and our team of qualified interior designers on questions and ideas relating to the design of their projects. Along with a number of project tools and resources being released as we speak, the Academy will arm individuals with the information and confidence to tackle their own projects, and achieve the designer finish they dream of.

contentBlocks.title: "Dress your curtains after you've installed them. You'll get that designer look with beautiful soft folds."

title: Sheer curtains add soft texture in this Palm Springs style home

contentBlocks.title: Coffs to Cali: an incredible beachside reno by Ash and Simon Vos, featuring designer sheer curtains from our Allusion range.
"We're really into the minimal yet design focussed Palm Springs aesthetic that brings the outdoors in!"

content.value: Hi Ash! Thanks for chatting with us about your new renovation, Coffs to Cali. We love your and Simon's Aussie take on the iconic Palm Springs style. What drew you to this style and how did you incorporate it into your beachside reno?

We’ve loved the Palm Springs mid-century modern style for a while. We’re really into the minimal yet design focussed aesthetic that brings the outdoors in! We wanted to incorporate the shapes and colours synonymous with the Palm Springs look in our home, while giving it a distinctly Australian vibe and using a more natural colour palette.

contentBlocks.title: "We brought in bold colours and took our inspiration from nature and the Great Dividing Range".

content.value: The colour palette you chose is bold and original - and a refreshing change from all white! Could you share your tips for experimenting with colour?

My design background has really influenced our colour choices. People are so afraid of colour these days, but it adds so much personality to a home. Colour can bring mood; transforms how you relax and replenish; and, combined with a lighting design, changes in feeling from morning to evening. Colour gives your home versatility.

We brought in bold colours, but kept things complementary by taking our inspiration from nature and the Great Dividing Range that’s out the back of our house. It’s great to use colour, but our best advice is to create a colour palette and look for the colour story you want to tell. Colours should work together before you put them on the walls.

contentBlocks.title: "We have a really strong vision for our lifestyle; it keeps us on point and ensures our creative energy isn’t taken up with hard conversations."

content.value: You both seem to have boundless energy and ideas! How do you stay inspired and tap into your creativity during a build?

Simon is a nature guy - when he’s not renovating, he’s deep diving in the ocean or surfing on the coast. He really lives in the moment and is inspired by nature at every turn. I’m the dreamer and I’m constantly gathering ideas and drawing plans for our next projects. I bring the forward thinking and will be cheekily discussing ideas with Simon for a few months before he thinks it’s his great idea.

We live in a beautiful part of Australia and went on plenty of walks during our renovation. Every penny went into the build; choosing quality time in nature was a good decision for us. It cost us nothing and we got to decompress most days with a bit of fresh air. We got to discuss textures and colour, tile decisions and more, and it felt like a date.
Do you have advice for couples renovating, in terms of communication and staying on the same page throughout a project? It’s obvious you shared a strong vision and worked incredibly as a team.

We both have similar taste when it comes to our renovation projects, so that helps a lot. We don’t agree on everything, but we have a really strong vision for our lifestyle; it keeps us on point and ensures our creative energy isn’t taken up with hard conversations. Forget the vision boards; they are important, but your house needs to be an embodiment of who you are and your future self. Picture yourself in ten years' time and what you want to have achieved; your space is going to be the resting place for your dreams and the starting point for those conversations and life decisions. Think about that before you think about anything else, and the rest will come.

I work from home remotely and the separation between work and home needs to feel immediate at the end of the working day. We personally value music, scent, mood and nature to do that. We used soundproof materials so we can play loud music without the neighbours hearing; designed lighting that dim across the whole house; chose colours that transform the space in the evening; and furnished the open plan living-dining with natural plush textures that let you sink into
relax
mode.

Also we completely trust each other. Renovating is hard and not for everyone; you have to divide and conquer on decisions and having a partner that can choose well and on behalf of both of you is really unique. We also laugh a lot, so when things get tough we just make a joke of it.

contentBlocks.title: "We wanted to furnish our windows in a bespoke way; retain maximum natural light; and add softness and calm to the space".

content.value: Your bespoke designer curtains are DIY from start to finish. Talk us through the process you went through, from ordering free samples through to DIY installation.

Wow, our curtains - where do we start! We had a really strong vision to let the outdoors in, which meant large scale windows. We wanted to furnish our windows in a bespoke way; retain maximum natural light; and add softness and calm to the space, especially given our minimal and sculptural furniture.

We ordered fabric samples from DIY Blinds early on in the planning stage of our renovation and then narrowed it down to two linen samples. We took the fabric samples with us to select the windows and exterior cladding colours and it was love at first sight; everything matched really well together.

From then it was pretty simple. We measured up and emailed through some images to the DIY Blinds team. We could have ordered straight away, but emailing the team gave us confidence that our selections were correct. Given we have a raked ceiling line, we needed to check the puddled finish and curtain fall with someone who knew a bit more than us! Delivery and install were the easiest parts of all. Everything arrived in record time, came perfectly packaged and took five minutes to install. The online installation guides are so helpful, but the process is pretty foolproof.

contentBlocks.title: "We talked through our ideas with the DIY Blinds team, who were so helpful from start to finish and gave us confidence in our decisions."

content.value: The sheer linen blend curtains you chose from our Allusion range filter light beautifully. How important to you are natural fibres and texture?

We’re all about nature in our house. We selected a natural fibre because it gave us privacy from the outside world, but filtered light beautifully in the home. We could tell that the Allusion range was going to have the versatility we needed to keep things private, while the natural finish and raw texture in the home gave us that vacation feeling!
Do you have any advice about how to customise curtains for raked ceilings like yours?

If you’re ordering custom window furnishings, think about enclosing the track for a seamless finish and always add a puddle! We talked through our ideas with the DIY Blinds team, who were so helpful from start to finish and gave us confidence in our decisions.
What can we look forward to seeing from Ash and Simon in 2021?

Good question! We have been dreaming up two projects: a Japanese inspired weekender; and an A-frame on some land (check out @aframekangaroovalley on Instagram for some inspo). Before we get into it though, Simon will be doing a lot of surfing to make up for all the weekends he missed out on during 2020.

title: Luxurious yet functional: Built By Wilson's latest family home is for sale. Get in quick!

contentBlocks.title: Built by Wilson's #NewtownCourtyardHouse has just been listed for sale. Snap up this light-filled architect designed home before it's gone! Featuring custom shutters, sheer curved curtains and roller blinds.
"We wanted to create the ultimate family home that allows connection and flow, but also has separate zones for living, work and kids."

content.value: Hi Lauren, congratulations on your new build project, Newtown Courtyard House! Where can people find the sale listing for this fabulous family abode?
Newtown Courtyard House is currently listed on
realestate.com.au
and
Domain
We love how light, bright and open the house feels. What was the brief to your architect?

We wanted to create the ultimate family home that allows connection and flow, but also has separate zones for living, work and kids. With so many people considering the move outside of Melbourne after COVID, we identified a gap in the market for beautiful family homes that are both functional and stylish. The internal courtyards tie the house together and the alfresco area with fireplace really completes the home.
Built By Wilson’s incredible projects are often featured in the world’s best interior design magazines. What's your secret to building homes that people lust after?

We love natural, textural and layered finishes, together with lots of light. Getting the floorplan of a house right is so important. We love that people get a surprise when they walk through one of our homes, due to the profound sense of space and highest quality finishes.

contentBlocks.title: "Furniture, art and object selections reflect the home's mid-century vibes and complement our luxurious internal finishes."

content.value: You’ve listed the property with the option to buy the fully styled interior package. Based on your experience, what are the top things families are looking for in a home?

We find that most families are seeking a large kitchen with butlers pantry, separate living zones for kids, a well-appointed study for those working from home, hardwearing bathrooms and connected alfresco spaces. All of which we included in this project.

In addition we engaged a stylist to curate the home's furnishings. Our aim was to truly set the project apart and present a complete home to market. Renowned Melbourne interior stylist Simone Haag assisted with all furniture, art and object selections to reflect the home's mid century vibes and to complement our luxurious internal finishes.

We love Simone's textured, timeless design aesthetic. We have been extremely lucky to have so many incredible furniture and product suppliers, in Geelong and Melbourne, supply products for the photoshoot and staging.

What’s a good starting point for someone wanting to add a touch of luxury in their home? At Newtown Courtyard House high-end finishes, natural materials and unique designer pieces create a completely luxe vibe.

We love using marble to create a sense of luxury. We designed a stunning custom blue quartz vanity for our powder room, which totally transforms the space. We think investing in feature lighting and wall sconces is also important. We have used colour in the living room and kids retreat, which has really created a sense of warmth and sophistication.
Lauren chose sheer curved curtains from our Burano range, colour Vanilla (image above).

contentBlocks.title: "We worked with a DIY Blinds design consultant, Kia, over the phone and on email. Together we chose window furnishings to complement each space."

content.value: We love that you chose a range of custom window furnishings to suit the needs of each space. Can you tell us about the process of selecting your blinds, curtains and shutters?

We worked with a DIY Blinds design consultant, Kia, over the phone and on email. Together we chose window furnishings to complement each space. The existing windows at the front of the house were perfect for shutters, and overlook a fully landscaped front yard. We chose sheer curtains for the living rooms to create a cosy, luxurious vibe. In the kids' rooms, we chose minimal blockout blinds to seamlessly fit to the windows.
How early would you recommend reaching out to our design team for advice?

Ideally, recessing all your curtain tracks in the ceiling creates the best outcome, so I would recommend making contact with DIY Blinds during your framing stage for advice. This is so you can work with your builder to set up everything perfectly.
I received all the fabric samples really quickly in the mail. This meant I could create a colour palette with paint, carpet, tiles and other finishes to ensure everything was cohesive.

contentBlocks.title: "We love natural, textural and layered finishes, together with lots of light."

content.value: Can you offer any tips for choosing the perfect colour and texture for your blinds? The white colour palette you used for all your window furnishings is beautiful.

I suggest getting your samples and materials together and viewing them in different lights. In my experience sheer curtains look darker en masse, so it is really important to put all your materials together. Initially I planned to do pale grey sheers, but when I put all the paint colours together the sheers looked so much better in vanilla.
Lauren chose PolyLux® shutters, colour Pure White (image above).

contentBlocks.title: "I suggest getting your samples and materials together and viewing them in different lights."

content.value: Are you able to let us in on any projects you have planned for the rest of this year?
We are working on an incredible heritage restoration project this year. We're also commencing a new beach house for clients in Barwon Heads, which will keep us busy!
Lauren chose blockout blinds from our One Block range, colour White (image above).

contentBlocks.title: At DIY Blinds we deliver designer quality for every budget

content.value: We custom make designer quality blinds at incredible value prices. Thanks to our disruptive online business model, anyone can afford designer window furnishings. That means every single DIY Blinds customer enjoys the same Australian workmanship, premium quality, designer fabrics and customer service.

We help people who are building or renovating on a budget achieve a luxe look in their home. We also work on higher end projects, but the designer quality is the same across every product our team makes. Regardless of budget, our designer blinds, curtains and shutters help transform any build project into a breathtaking home.
Call us to chat with our expert design consultants.

title: Lined curtains are now available online! Enjoy incredible thermal insulation over winter

contentBlocks.title: Order lined curtains for winter! Pick a luxe sheer and add a lining to insulate your home and block cold draughts.
Twice the luxury: lined sheer curtains

content.value: [klaviyo-signup-form form-id="klaviyo-form-VKRE5Z"]
Lining a premium sheer curtain is a designer's best kept secret.
Lined curtains

inject soft texture into your home, whilst helping protect it from the outside elements. Our customers can now choose any sheer curtain in our range, and add a blockout lining. The two fabrics are joined together to form one plush lined curtain on a single track. They look fantastic and work really hard to insulate your home during the winter months.

Our linings are made of blockout materials, which block light from coming in and create total privacy when you need it. The blockout lining helps to absorb the sun's UV rays, and preserves your beautiful sheer fabric so it won't fade.
Alison Lewis chose to line sheers from our Allusion range, colour Rattan (see image above).

contentBlocks.title: Enjoy better insulation and noise absorption

content.value: Lined curtains are one of the most insulating window furnishings.

Lined curtains prevent heat from escaping via your windows. To help eliminate cold draughts choose floor-to-ceiling lined curtains, and go for a wall-to-wall look if possible. We can help you design, measure and install your curtains for maximum insulation.

They can also reduce outside noise like traffic, aircraft or your neighbours throwing a party. They create an extra barrier between the outside world and your home. In fact lined curtains are a great alternative to adding additional glazing to your windows (although combining lined curtains with double glazing would be the best option). Lined curtains can also help absorb internal sounds for better acoustics in your rooms.
Ivy Huang chose to line curtains from our Aurora range, colour Linen (see image above).
